column2: This jQuery plugin enables very basic bookmarkable #hash history via a cross-browser HTML5 window.onhashchange event.

column5: Added missing file for "Bug in Firefox: Remote XMLHttpRequest" example
Unit tests pass in all browsers, releasing v1.3
Fixed IE8 "IE7 compatibility" mode regression, renamed jQuery.hashchange* properties to jQuery.fn.hashchange.*, misc cleanup
All unit tests now pass in BlackBerry 4.6.1 and 5.0 (mainly QUnit issues)
Added $.fn.hashchange shortcut method, other minor tweaks.
Further modularized IE6/7 code for maximum ease-of-removal for mobile development. Also, slight minification tweaks.
Changed window['location']['href'] to location.href to fix OMG FUN bug in blackberry 4.6. Closes #9.
Attempt to make Iframe as hidden as possible by using techniques from http://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/?p=604. Closes #10.

Reorganized IE6/7 Iframe code to make it more removable (for mobile dev) and added support for document.domain in IE6/7 via jQuery.hashchangeDomain and jQuery.hashchangeIframeSrc properties. Lowered default jQuery.hashchangeDelay value to 50 milliseconds. This commit fixed issue #5.
Updated jQuery 1.4.2pre unit tests to 1.4.2, added 1.2.6, and switched tests and examples to use 1.4.2 by default
Worked around a Safari bug (issue #2), event can noew be bound before DOM ready, and IE6/7 page should no longer scroll when the event is first bound.
Added and tested jQuery 1.4.1, all systems go!
Incorporated document.documentMode test to fix IE8 bug where browser version is incorrectly reported as 8.0, despite inclusion of the X-UA-Compatible IE=EmulateIE7 meta tag.
